alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Grainger; Hancock (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 8:39AM CST until February 19 at 3:52PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...Tennessee... Clinch River Near Speers Ferry VA affecting Scott and Hancock Counties. Clinch River Above Tazewell TN affecting Grainger, Claiborne and Hancock Counties. Powell River Near Arthur TN affecting Claiborne and Union Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia...Tennessee... North Fork Holston River Near Gate City VA affecting Scott, Hawkins and Sullivan Counties. Sequatchie River Near Whitwell TN affecting Bledsoe, Marion and Sequatchie Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clinch River above Tazewell TN. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Action stage. At 12.0 feet, Flooding of pasture land near Grissom Island begins. The city of Tazewell, Tennessee is not affected by flooding of the Clinch River. At 16.0 feet, Extensive flooding of pasture land around Grissom Island occurs. The city of Tazewell, Tennessee is not affected by flooding of the Clinch River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM EST Saturday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM EST Saturday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 15.8 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1045 AM EST /945 AM CST/.
